person.persName: Lewis Lettig Pinkerton (Woodford County, Kentucky minister, school founder, asst surgeon 11th Ky Cav USA)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, minister, educator, philanthropist, surgeon, and soldier. Baltimore County, Maryland, native. Married to Sarah Ann Ball Pinkerton in Butler County, Ohio, on March 19, 1833. Father of William W. Pinkerton, Virginia L. Pinkerton, Burnett S. Pinkerton, James P. Pinkerton, Samuel D. Pinkerton, L.M. Pinkerton, and Mary B. Pinkerton. Founder of Baconian Institute in Midway, Kentucky, in 1845. Founder of the Kentucky Female Orphan School for women in Midway in 1847. Minister of the Midway Christian Church in Midway in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1850. Minister in Woodford County in 1860. Professor of Belles-Lettres, History, and Political Philosophy at Kentucky University in Harrodsburg in 1860 and 1861. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as assistant surgeon from August 13, 1862, to May 28, 1863.
